summary: Over the 6‑hour window winds were generally moderate and steady (mean ~13.7, std ~1.5) with an extreme peak to 43.7; power averaged ~0.93 with modest variability (std ~0.12) but showed greater fluctuation than the wind variability alone would predict. Rotor speed was tightly stable (std ~1.6) while generator speed exhibited much larger swings (std ~179), and blade pitch and yaw angles remained near ~8 on average; ambient temperature averaged ~72.5. The unit remained in a non‑standard operational state for the entire period, while mean power residuals were small (~0.01), indicating short-lived mismatches between expected and actual output.
